column1: TA3.38;The Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's extraction capacity is able to extract the ores
column2: minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: to the extent that the Union’s reserves allow for this;TA4.1;+;The implementation of TA3.38 is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.1
column4: as a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials can support the production of sustainable biomethane
column5: which is a key component of the EU's energy strategy.

column1: TA3.38;The Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's extraction capacity is able to extract the ores
column2: minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: to the extent that the Union’s reserves allow for this;TA4.10;-;However
column4: the increased extraction of critical raw materials required to meet the targets of TA3.38 may lead to increased energy consumption and emissions in the transportation sector
column5: potentially hindering the progress towards TA4.10.

column1: TA3.39;The Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's processing capacity
column2: including for all intermediate processing steps
column3: is able to produce at least 40% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials;TA4.1;+;The implementation of TA3.39 can have a positive impact on TA4.1
column4: as a secure and sustainable supply of processed critical raw materials can support the production of sustainable biomethane and other low-carbon energy sources.

column1: TA3.40;Member States shall meet the target of 77% by weight for the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles by 2025 and 90% by 2029;TA4.5;+;The implementation of TA3.40 can have a positive impact on TA4.5
column2: as the increased recycling of plastic waste can support the production of sustainable fuels and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the transportation sector.

column1: TA3.41;From 2019
column2: the minimum collection rate to be achieved annually shall be 65 % of the average weight of EEE placed on the market in the Member State concerned
column3: or alternatively 85 % of WEEE generated on the territory of that Member State;TA4.14;+;The implementation of TA3.41 can have a positive impact on TA4.14
column4: as the increased collection and recycling of WEEE can support the production of sustainable fuels and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the transportation sector.

column1: TA3.42;From 15 August 2018
column2: the recovery targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: 85% for Category 1
column3: 80% for Category 2
column4: and 75% for Category 5 or 6;TA4.14;+;The implementation of TA3.42 can have a positive impact on TA4.14
column5: as the increased recovery and recycling of WEEE can support the production of sustainable fuels and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the transportation sector.

column1: TA3.43;From 15 August 2018
column2: the preparation for re-use targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: 80% for Category 1 or Category 4
column3: 70% for Category 2
column4: and 55% for Category 5 or Category 6;TA4.14;+;The implementation of TA3.43 can have a positive impact on TA4.14
column5: as the increased preparation for re-use and recycling of WEEE can support the production of sustainable fuels and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the transportation sector.

column1: TA3.44;From 15 August 2018
column2: the recycling targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: 0% for Category 1 or Category 4
column3: 70% for Category 2
column4: and 55% for Category 5 or Category 6;TA4.14;+;The implementation of TA3.44 can have a positive impact on TA4.14
column5: as the increased recycling of WEEE can support the production of sustainable fuels and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the transportation sector.

column2: the preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste shall be increased to a minimum of 55% by weight
column3: and by 2030 to 65% by weight;TA4.14;+;The implementation of TA3.45 can have a positive impact on TA4.14
column4: as the increased preparation for re-use and recycling of municipal waste can support the production of sustainable fuels and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the transportation sector.

column1: TA3.46;Member States should aim to achieve an indicative Union-wide food waste reduction target of 30 % by 2025 and 50 % by 2030;TA5.13;+;The implementation of TA3.46 can have a positive impact on TA5.13
column2: as reducing food waste can support the production of sustainable biomethane and other low-carbon energy sources.

column1: TA3.47;Hazardous household waste will have to be collected separately by 2022
column2: bio-waste by 2023 and textiles by 2025;TA5.14;+;The implementation of TA3.47 can have a positive impact on TA5.14
column3: as the separate collection of hazardous household waste
column5: and textiles can support the production of sustainable biomethane and other low-carbon energy sources.

column1: TA3.48;nan;TA4.1;-;There is no target content for TA3.48
column2: so there is no impact on TA4.1.

column1: TA3.5;By 2030 producers will have responsibility for their products along the value chain
column2: including when they become waste. The circular textiles ecosystem is thriving
column3: driven by sufficient capacities for innovative fibre-to-fibre recycling
column4: while the incineration and landfilling of textiles is reduced to the minimum.;TA4.5;+;The implementation of TA3.5 can have a positive impact on TA4.5
column5: as the increased recycling and re-use of textiles can support the production of sustainable fuels and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the transportation sector.

column1: TA3.6;nan;TA4.1;-;There is no target content for TA3.6
column2: so there is no impact on TA4.1.

column1: TA3.7;nan;TA4.1;-;There is no target content for TA3.7
column2: so there is no impact on TA4.1.

column1: TA3.8;The Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's extraction capacity is able to extract the ores
column2: minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: to the extent that the Union’s reserves allow for this;TA4.1;+;The implementation of TA3.8 is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.1
column4: as a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials can support the production of sustainable biomethane
column5: which is a key component of the EU's energy strategy.

column1: TA3.9;The Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's processing capacity
column2: including for all intermediate processing steps
column3: is able to produce at least 40% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials;TA4.1;+;The implementation of TA3.9 can have a positive impact on TA4.1
column4: as a secure and sustainable supply of processed critical raw materials can support the production of sustainable biomethane and other low-carbon energy sources.

column1: TA4.1;*The amendments in Dir. 2023/2413 are also intended to support the achievement of the Union’s target of an annual production of sustainable biomethane of 35 billion cubic meters by 2030;TA3.38;+;The implementation of TA4.1 can have a positive impact on TA3.38
column2: as the increased production of sustainable biomethane can support the development of a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials.

column1: TA4.10;EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend
column2: as observed for the period 2009-2019
column3: towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030;TA3.40;-;The implementation of TA4.10 may have a negative impact on TA3.40
column4: as the increased fuel efficiency in the fishing sector may lead to increased plastic waste generation.

column1: TA4.11;Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years;TA3.42;+;The implementation of TA4.11 can have a positive impact on TA3.42
column2: as the increased efficiency in transportation can support the recycling and re-use of WEEE.

column1: TA4.12;GHG intensity reduction target in the maritime sector;TA3.40;-;The implementation of TA4.12 may have a negative impact on TA3.40
column2: as the increased focus on reducing greenhouse gas emissions in the maritime sector may lead to increased plastic waste generation.

column1: TA4.13;For new urban buses the share of zeroemissions vehicles shall be 100% as from the reporting period of the year 2030;TA3.5;+;The implementation of TA4.13 can have a positive impact on TA3.5
column2: as the increased adoption of zero-emission vehicles can support the development of a circular textiles ecosystem.

column1: TA4.14;Renewable and low-carbon fuels should represent between 6% and 9% of the international maritime transport fuel mix by 2030 and between 86% and 88% by 2050;TA3.40;+;The implementation of TA4.14 can have a positive impact on TA3.40
column2: as the increased use of renewable and low-carbon fuels can support the reduction of plastic waste generation.

column1: TA4.15;The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles
column2: other than special purpose
column3: off-road
column5: and vocational vehicles shall be reduced by the following percentages compared to the average CO2 emissions of the reporting period of the year 2019;TA3.42;+;The implementation of TA4.15 can have a positive impact on TA3.42
column6: as the increased efficiency in transportation can support the recycling and re-use of WEEE.

column1: TA4.16;From 1 January 2020
column2: this Regulation sets an EU fleet-wide target of 95 g CO2/km for the average emissions of new passenger cars and an EU fleet-wide target of 147 g CO2/km for the average emissions of new light commercial vehicles registered in the Union;TA3.42;+;The implementation of TA4.16 can have a positive impact on TA3.42
column3: as the increased efficiency in transportation can support the recycling and re-use of WEEE.

column1: TA4.17;This Regulation will
column2: until 31 December 2024
column3: be complemented by additional measures corresponding to a reduction of 10 g CO2/km as part of the Union's integrated approach;TA3.42;+;The implementation of TA4.17 can have a positive impact on TA3.42
column4: as the increased efficiency in transportation can support the recycling and re-use of WEEE.

column2: so there is no impact on TA3.42.

column2: so there is no impact on TA3.46.

column1: TA5.10;Increase renewable energy in agriculture and food sector. Adopt energy efficiency solutions in the agriculture and food sector
column2: by reducing energy consumption;TA3.38;+;The implementation of TA5.10 can have a positive impact on TA3.38
column3: as the increased use of renewable energy and energy efficiency solutions can support the development of a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials.

column1: TA5.11;Protect the environment and restore natural resources. Preserve biodiversity and reduce biodiversity loss;TA3.47;+;The implementation of TA5.11 can have a positive impact on TA3.47
column2: as the increased protection of the environment and restoration of natural resources can support the separate collection of hazardous household waste
column3: bio-waste

column1: TA5.12;Secure and ensure access to a range of quality seeds for plant varieties in order to adapt to the pressures of climate change;TA3.38;+;The implementation of TA5.12 can have a positive impact on TA3.38
column2: as the increased access to quality seeds can support the development of a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials.

column1: TA5.13;Reduce food waste. Prevent food loss and waste;TA3.46;+;The implementation of TA5.13 can have a positive impact on TA3.46
column2: as the reduced food waste can support the production of sustainable biomethane and other low-carbon energy sources.

column1: TA5.14;Scale-up and promote sustainable and socially responsible production methods and circular business models in food processing and retail;TA3.5;+;The implementation of TA5.14 can have a positive impact on TA3.5
column2: as the increased adoption of sustainable and circular production methods can support the development of a circular textiles ecosystem.

column1: TA5.15;Reduce the environmental and climate footprint of the EU food system
column2: operating within planetary boundaries;TA3.40;+;The implementation of TA5.15 can have a positive impact on TA3.40
column3: as the reduced environmental and climate footprint can support the reduction of plastic waste generation.

column1: TA5.16;Ensure fair income and salaries. Improve income of primary producers to ensure their sustainable livelihood;TA3.38;+;The implementation of TA5.16 can have a positive impact on TA3.38
column2: as the increased income of primary producers can support the development of a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials.

column1: TA5.17;Help farmers and fishers to strengthen their position in the supply chain and to capture a fair share of the added value of sustainable production;TA3.38;+;The implementation of TA5.17 can have a positive impact on TA3.38
column2: as the increased position of farmers and fishers in the supply chain can support the development of a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials.

column1: TA5.18;Improve agricultural rules that strengthen the position of farmers
column2: their cooperatives and producer organisations in the food supply chain;TA3.38;+;The implementation of TA5.18 can have a positive impact on TA3.38
column3: as the improved agricultural rules can support the development of a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials.

column1: TA5.19;Preserve the affordability of food;TA3.46;-;The implementation of TA5.19 may have a negative impact on TA3.46
column2: as the preserved affordability of food may lead to increased food waste generation.
